definition: to love and respect/love and respect
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
surname Dai
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

sentences.english: The teacher's democratic attitude made her popular among her pupils.
sentences.chinese: 該教師平等待人的態度時她受到了學生的愛戴。

sentences.english: The man was an undercover deputy from Iredell County Sheriff's Office.
sentences.chinese: 這名男子是愛戴爾郡警局的臥底警員。

sentences.english: Jieyou lived in Wusun for more than 50 years and enjoyed the love and respect of the Wusun people.
sentences.chinese: 她在烏孫國生活了五十多年，深受烏孫人民的愛戴。

sentences.english: The next day, Ed visited a famous statesman who was respected by people.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，愛德拜訪了一位著名的人民愛戴的政治家。

sentences.english: With good stability and high output, Huihong Machinery are recognized and favored by the industry.
sentences.chinese: 輝鋐機器穩定性佳，產量高，深受業界的認同與愛戴。

sentences.english: I read the reviews for Ardell and decided to try it.
sentences.chinese: 我讀了關於愛戴爾睫毛增長液的評論並決定試一試。

sentences.english: Before long, the one-hundredth prince gained the respect and affection of all.
sentences.chinese: 沒過多久，第一百位王子就得到所有人的尊敬和愛戴。

sentences.english: The teacher's democracy made her popular among her pupils.
sentences.chinese: 教師的民主作風使她受到學生的愛戴。

sentences.english: He will follow the good Siddartha loved by the people.
sentences.chinese: 他要追隨人所愛戴的傑出的悉達多。

sentences.english: He explains why Beverly Sills became America's beloved diva .
sentences.chinese: 他解釋了爲什麼希爾斯能成爲美國最受愛戴的演員。

sentences.english: Up and down the country people more loved lill princess.
sentences.chinese: 全國上下的人民更加愛戴莉兒公主了。

sentences.english: And yet that's what we strive for, in loving God.
sentences.chinese: 但這卻是我們在愛戴上帝的同時所追求的。

sentences.english: The veteran worker ranks high in public love and esteem.
sentences.chinese: 那位老工人深受大夥的愛戴。

sentences.english: The Neapolitan fans had with Diego a relationship based on affection and love, honoring him as a God.
sentences.chinese: 他贏得了那不勒斯隊球迷們的愛戴，稱他爲足球之神。

sentences.english: The teacher has won the love and esteem of his (or her) students.
sentences.chinese: 這位老師關心同學，嚴以律己，深受學生們的愛戴。

sentences.english: David Attenborough is one of Britain's best-loved TV presenters.
sentences.chinese: 大衛艾登堡是深受英國觀衆愛戴的電視主持人之一。

definition: (lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
to trust/to have confidence in/to have faith in/to rely on
to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
favor/liking/love/jubilation/joy
to focus attention upon
to discuss sth enthusiastically
(of an area) vast or extensive/large-scale/widespread/(of people) numerous
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
fan/fanatic
to praise/to laud
to praise/to acclaim/to commend/to compliment
devotion/fervor
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
